sentences.english: And the implication of flowers and paintings will be unparalleledly illustrated in some of her special design.
sentences.chinese: 此次以独特设计体现花意与画意的另类表达。

sentences.english: Avoid  alternative investments and private partnerships that might be hard to sell.
sentences.chinese: 不要做可能难于脱手的另类投资或私人合伙投资。

sentences.english: Quite a few female verses dissociate from the literary history.
sentences.chinese: 好象女性诗歌是游离于文学史之外的另类。

sentences.english: All of this provides a different sort of argument for the preservation of nature.
sentences.chinese: 所有的这些给出的都是保护大自然的另类论据。

sentences.english: World traveler Chris Guillebeau writes at The Art of Nonconformity.
sentences.chinese: 坏球旅行者克里斯吉尔博写在另类艺术中。
有些批判者们说她太另类了。

sentences.english: However, the horse rode by the lady of the Guo State is absolutely another sort of animal.
sentences.chinese: 而虢国夫人游春的坐骑，完全是另类牲口了。

sentences.english: For the selection committee, using other criteria bears the risk of being discredited.
sentences.chinese: 选拔委员会用另类的标准来屏蔽不受信任的风险。

sentences.english: It is agreed that Jiangyou thinkers of the Song Dynasty, on the whole, had "special" characteristics.
sentences.chinese: 从整体而言，宋代江右思想家具有“另类”之特质。

sentences.english: Just like the different conversation in between mother and me at this moment, that is imperceptible destiny.
sentences.chinese: 就如此刻我与母亲的另类对话，这是冥冥的天定。

sentences.english: Engineering is, among others, a path to new kinds of beauty.
sentences.chinese: 在众多领域里，工程建设是通向另类美丽的一种途径。

sentences.english: One of the characters who appears abruptly in this story is Mr. Garrido's ailing mother.
sentences.chinese: 在书中有一个角色稍显另类，就是加里多生病的母亲。

sentences.english: Over the past decade, however, a different sort of free has emerged.
sentences.chinese: 然而，过去十年间，一种另类的免费策略开始出现。

sentences.english: But they are consistently exotic, always other.
sentences.chinese: 但是他们有着另类的异国情调。

sentences.english: His sudden death is a strange kind of victory.
sentences.chinese: 他的猝然离世亦是一种另类的胜利。

definition: to rebel against orthodoxy/to depart from established practices
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
to stand out from the masses (idiom)
to hit on sth new (idiom); to display originality/to adopt an original approach
lit. new bud/fig. new and original
lit. to fly one's banner on a solitary tree (idiom); fig. to act as a loner/to stand out/to develop one's own school/to have attitude of one's own
the sword moves with side stroke (modern idiom)/fig. unexpected winning move/unconventional gambit
Jian Zoupianfeng, pseudonym of prolific modern novelist
comical/funny/amusing/old pr. [gu3 ji1]/huaji, a form of comedy performance popular in Shanghai, Jiangsu and Zhejiang
